frameDefinitions: The speaker believes that some state of affairs or entity (the Requirement) must be present in order to cause some other dependent state of affairs to occur (the Dependent).
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.
An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.
This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
The Jury discuss the Case and its Charges in order to evaluate the  Possible_sentence of the accused.
frameExamples: Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
The judge <t>ruled</t> yesterday that the revisions were not adequate. DNI
Dad <t>taught</t> me that if you work hard, you will be OK - no matter what happens.
listRoleDefinitions: The Cognizer requires or believes he/she requires the Requirement to hold so that the Dependent will occur.
The entity or state-of-affairs that must be present or obtain in order for the Dependent to obtain.
The state-of-affairs which cannot hold without the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
An undesirable state-of-affairs that results if the <fen>Requirement</fen> is not met.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> when he/she requires the <fen>Requirement</fen>.
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Authority</fen>'s deliberation or consideration.
This role describes the question on which the <fen>Authority</fen> gives a <fen>Finding</fen>.
The person about whom the <fen>Authority</fen> passes a judgment or <fen>Finding</fen>.
When the Authority gives his <fen>Finding</fen>.
Where the <fen>Finding</fen> takes place.
One who instructs a <fen>Student</fen> in some area of knowledge or skill.
One who is instructed by a <fen>Teacher</fen> in skills or knowledge.
An educational establishment, such as a school or college.
The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or to a <fen>Student</fen>.
A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming.
An action which the <fen>Student</fen> is able to perform as a result of instruction.
A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions.
A piece of information that the <fen>Student</fen> is informed of by the <fen>Teacher</fen>.
Educational <fen>Material</fen>, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a <fen>Teacher</fen> or a <fen>Student</fen> to acquire skills or knowledge.
A role, typically professional or vocational,  that the <fen>Student</fen> is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training.
FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject
The time when the teaching occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which the teaching takes place.

Consider whether a possible <fen>Place</fen> phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the <fen>Institution</fen>.
The group that debates the case.
The legal label for the crime that the defendant is accused of.
The <fen>Case</fen> which a trial is convened to decide.
A sentence that the jury considers during deliberation.
When the deliberation takes place.
Where the deliberation takes place.
listRoleExamples: He needs to focus on his schoolwork, <fex>or he's not going to pass the third grade</fex>.
I need that book <fex>now</fex>!
<fex>Over at Merv's house</fex> they need three more cement trucks to finish the job.
<fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
You will also be graded <fex>on your speed of response</fex> .
<fex>The study</fex> evaluated the risk of a major quake.
<fex>This chapter</fex> evaluates the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .
The committee rated Smithers ' most loyal servant ' <fex>about a week ago</fex> .
They 'll evaluate you <fex>in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .
<fex>The US International Trade Commission</fex> ruled that a 1987 anti-dumping tariff against frozen concentrated orange juice from Brazil could be revoked DNI.
Miss Mahmod's father ruled <fex>that she would never marry him</fex>.
US Supreme Court ruled <fex>on flag salutes in public schools</fex> today.
They held judgment <fex>upon me</fex> as a convicted traitress.
She's a <fex>French</fex> Teacher
She's Studying <fex>for a Master's degree</fex>
Taut with worry, Dad taught us <fex>how to drive</fex>.
My brother taught me <fex>not to be mean to guys when I'm not interested in them</fex>.
When I was two she taught me <fex>that a quarter was 25 cents and a dime was 10 cents</fex>.
All employees have received <fex>a booklet</fex> INSTRUCTING them on how to report ` anything from unwanted touching and uncalled-for blue jokes to overt demands for sexual favours . '
When his father died he went to live with an uncle in Ka'u who trained him <fex>as a warrior</fex> during his teenage years
The jury deliberated <fex>his guilt</fex>.
The jury deliberated for three hours <fex>last Tuesday.</fex>.
The jury deliberated for several hours <fex>in the Oakland courthouse</fex>.
